source.class:
CRL data, and its envelope DER encoded crl raw signature bits DER encoded "to-be-signed" CRL sig alg in CRL crl information sig alg in "to-be-signed" crl Parses an X.509 CRL, should be used only by constructors.

An implmentation for X509 CRL (Certificate Revocation List).

The X.509 v2 CRL format is described below in ASN.1: 

                  CertificateList  ::=  SEQUENCE  {
                  tbsCertList          TBSCertList,
                  signatureAlgorithm   AlgorithmIdentifier,
                  signature            BIT STRING  }
More information can be found in RFC 3280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and CRL Profile.

The ASN.1 definition of tbsCertList is: 

                  TBSCertList  ::=  SEQUENCE  {
                  version                 Version OPTIONAL,
                  -- if present, must be v2
                  signature               AlgorithmIdentifier,
                  issuer                  Name,
                  thisUpdate              ChoiceOfTime,
                  nextUpdate              ChoiceOfTime OPTIONAL,
                  revokedCertificates     SEQUENCE OF SEQUENCE  {
                  userCertificate         CertificateSerialNumber,
                  revocationDate          ChoiceOfTime,
                  crlEntryExtensions      Extensions OPTIONAL
                  -- if present, must be v2
                  }  OPTIONAL,
                  crlExtensions           [0]  EXPLICIT Extensions OPTIONAL
                  -- if present, must be v2
                  }
Hemma Prafullchandra X509CRL PublicKey that has previously been used to successfully verify the signature of this CRL. Null if the CRL has not yet been verified (successfully). If verifiedPublicKey is not null, name of the provider used to successfully verify the signature of this CRL, or the empty String if no provider was explicitly specified. Not to be used. As it would lead to cases of uninitialized CRL objects. Unmarshals an X.509 CRL from its encoded form, parsing the encoded bytes. This form of constructor is used by agents which need to examine and use CRL contents. Note that the buffer must include only one CRL, and no "garbage" may be left at the end. crlData the encoded bytes, with no trailing padding. CRLException on parsing errors. Unmarshals an X.509 CRL from an DER value. val a DER value holding at least one CRL CRLException on parsing errors. Unmarshals an X.509 CRL from an input stream. Only one CRL is expected at the end of the input stream. inStrm an input stream holding at least one CRL CRLException on parsing errors. Initial CRL constructor, no revoked certs, and no extensions. issuer the name of the CA issuing this CRL. thisUpdate the Date of this issue. nextUpdate the Date of the next CRL. CRL constructor, revoked certs, no extensions. issuer the name of the CA issuing this CRL. thisUpdate the Date of this issue. nextUpdate the Date of the next CRL. badCerts the array of CRL entries. CRLException on parsing/construction errors. CRL constructor, revoked certs and extensions. issuer the name of the CA issuing this CRL. thisUpdate the Date of this issue. nextUpdate the Date of the next CRL. badCerts the array of CRL entries. crlExts the CRL extensions. CRLException on parsing/construction errors. Returned the encoding as an uncloned byte array. Callers must guarantee that they neither modify it nor expose it to untrusted code. Returns the ASN.1 DER encoded form of this CRL. CRLException if an encoding error occurs. Encodes the "to-be-signed" CRL to the OutputStream. out the OutputStream to write to. CRLException on encoding errors. v2 crl encode version Verifies that this CRL was signed using the private key that corresponds to the given public key. key the PublicKey used to carry out the verification. NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms. InvalidKeyException on incorrect key. NoSuchProviderException if there's no default provider. SignatureException on signature errors. CRLException on encoding errors. Verifies that this CRL was signed using the private key that corresponds to the given public key, and that the signature verification was computed by the given provider. key the PublicKey used to carry out the verification. sigProvider the name of the signature provider. NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms. InvalidKeyException on incorrect key. NoSuchProviderException on incorrect provider. SignatureException on signature errors. CRLException on encoding errors. this CRL has already been successfully verified using this public key. Make sure providers match, too. Encodes an X.509 CRL, and signs it using the given key. key the private key used for signing. algorithm the name of the signature algorithm used. NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms. InvalidKeyException on incorrect key. NoSuchProviderException on incorrect provider. SignatureException on signature errors. CRLException if any mandatory data was omitted. Encodes an X.509 CRL, and signs it using the given key. key the private key used for signing. algorithm the name of the signature algorithm used. provider the name of the provider. NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms. InvalidKeyException on incorrect key. NoSuchProviderException on incorrect provider. SignatureException on signature errors. CRLException if any mandatory data was omitted. in case the name is reset encode crl info encode algorithm identifier Create and encode the signature itself. Wrap the signed data in a SEQUENCE { data, algorithm, sig } Returns a printable string of this CRL. value of this CRL in a printable form. sub-class exists Checks whether the given certificate is on this CRL. cert the certificate to check for. true if the given certificate is on this CRL, false otherwise. Gets the version number from this CRL. The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
                  Version  ::=  INTEGER  {  v1(0), v2(1), v3(2)  }
                  -- v3 does not apply to CRLs but appears for consistency
                  -- with definition of Version for certs
the version number, i.e. 1 or 2. Gets the issuer distinguished name from this CRL. The issuer name identifies the entity who has signed (and issued the CRL). The issuer name field contains an X.500 distinguished name (DN). The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
                  issuer    Name
                  Name ::= CHOICE { RDNSequence }
                  RDNSequence ::= SEQUENCE OF RelativeDistinguishedName
                  RelativeDistinguishedName ::=
                  SET OF AttributeValueAssertion
                  AttributeValueAssertion ::= SEQUENCE {
                  AttributeType,
                  AttributeValue }
                  AttributeType ::= OBJECT IDENTIFIER
                  AttributeValue ::= ANY
The Name describes a hierarchical name composed of attributes, such as country name, and corresponding values, such as US. The type of the component AttributeValue is determined by the AttributeType; in general it will be a directoryString. A directoryString is usually one of PrintableString, TeletexString or UniversalString. the issuer name. Return the issuer as X500Principal. Overrides method in X509CRL to provide a slightly more efficient version. Gets the thisUpdate date from the CRL. The ASN.1 definition for this is: the thisUpdate date from the CRL. Gets the nextUpdate date from the CRL. the nextUpdate date from the CRL, or null if not present. Gets the CRL entry with the given serial number from this CRL. the entry with the given serial number, or null if no such entry exists in the CRL. X509CRLEntry assume this is a direct CRL entry (cert and CRL issuer are the same) Gets the CRL entry for the given certificate. Gets all the revoked certificates from the CRL. A Set of X509CRLEntry. all the revoked certificates or null if there are none. X509CRLEntry Gets the DER encoded CRL information, the tbsCertList from this CRL. This can be used to verify the signature independently. the DER encoded CRL information. CRLException on encoding errors. Gets the raw Signature bits from the CRL. the signature. Gets the signature algorithm name for the CRL signature algorithm. For example, the string "SHA1withDSA". The ASN.1 definition for this is: 
                  AlgorithmIdentifier  ::=  SEQUENCE  {
                  algorithm               OBJECT IDENTIFIER,
                  parameters              ANY DEFINED BY algorithm OPTIONAL  }
                  -- contains a value of the type
                  -- registered for use with the
                  -- algorithm object identifier value
the signature algorithm name. Gets the signature algorithm OID string from the CRL. An OID is represented by a set of positive whole number separated by ".", that means,
<positive whole number>.<positive whole number>.<...> For example, the string "1.2.840.10040.4.3" identifies the SHA-1 with DSA signature algorithm defined in RFC 3279: Algorithms and Identifiers for the Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and CRL Profile. the signature algorithm oid string. Gets the DER encoded signature algorithm parameters from this CRL's signature algorithm. In most cases, the signature algorithm parameters are null, the parameters are usually supplied with the Public Key. the DER encoded signature algorithm parameters, or null if no parameters are present. Gets the signature AlgorithmId from the CRL. the signature AlgorithmId return the AuthorityKeyIdentifier, if any. AuthorityKeyIdentifier or null (if no AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension) IOException on error return the AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension, if any. AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the CRLNumberExtension, if any. CRLNumberExtension or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the CRL number from the CRLNumberExtension, if any. number or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the DeltaCRLIndicatorExtension, if any. DeltaCRLIndicatorExtension or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the base CRL number from the DeltaCRLIndicatorExtension, if any. number or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the IssuerAlternativeNameExtension, if any. IssuerAlternativeNameExtension or null (if no such extension) IOException on error return the IssuingDistributionPointExtension, if any. IssuingDistributionPointExtension or null (if no such extension) IOException on error Return true if a critical extension is found that is not supported, otherwise return false. Gets a Set of the extension(s) marked CRITICAL in the CRL. In the returned set, each extension is represented by its OID string. a set of the extension oid strings in the CRL that are marked critical. Gets a Set of the extension(s) marked NON-CRITICAL in the CRL. In the returned set, each extension is represented by its OID string. a set of the extension oid strings in the CRL that are NOT marked critical. Gets the DER encoded OCTET string for the extension value (extnValue) identified by the passed in oid String. The oid string is represented by a set of positive whole number separated by ".", that means,
<positive whole number>.<positive whole number>.<...> oid the Object Identifier value for the extension. the der encoded octet string of the extension value. may be unknown get an extension oid ObjectIdentifier of extension desired Object of type or null, if not found IOException on error XXX Consider cloning this check if can over write the certificate the tbsCertsList parse the information version (optional if v1) by default, version = v1 == 0 i.e. v2 signature the "inner" and "outer" signature algorithms must match issuer thisUpdate check if UTCTime encoded or GeneralizedTime done parsing no more optional fields present nextUpdate (optional) else it is not present done parsing no more optional fields present revokedCertificates (optional) done parsing no extensions crlExtensions (optional) Extract the issuer X500Principal from an X509CRL. Parses the encoded form of the CRL to preserve the principal's ASN.1 encoding. Called by java.security.cert.X509CRL.getIssuerX500Principal(). skip version number if present skip signature issuer Returned the encoding of the given certificate for internal use. Callers must guarantee that they neither modify it nor expose it to untrusted code. Uses getEncodedInternal() if the certificate is instance of X509CertImpl, getEncoded() otherwise. Utility method to convert an arbitrary instance of X509CRL to a X509CRLImpl. Does a cast if possible, otherwise reparses the encoding. Returns the X500 certificate issuer DN of a CRL entry. entry the entry to check prevCertIssuer the previous entry's certificate issuer the X500Principal in a CertificateIssuerExtension, or prevCertIssuer if it does not exist Immutable X.509 Certificate Issuer DN and serial number pair Create an X509IssuerSerial. issuer the issuer DN serial the serial number Construct an X509IssuerSerial from an X509Certificate. Returns the issuer. the issuer Returns the serial number. the serial number Compares this X509Serial with another and returns true if they are equivalent. o the other object to compare with true if equal, false otherwise Returns a hash code value for this X509IssuerSerial. the hash code value
